text:
Hello everyone, i'm trying to setup a workflow on HS based on a webhook. I'm trying to get contacts from Shopify and create them on HubSpot.

Is there a way to enroll non existing contacts on HubSpot based on what's coming from the webhook ? When i create the webhook i'm asked for a unique property to match the coming record to an existing record so it can be enrolled, but as i want to create contacts, they are non existing.

Is there a way to do that ? Thank you
Interested by any answer. I’ve tested and if the email already exists, workflow enrolls correctly, but if the email does not exist, then it doesn’t enroll and yet we have 202 code “Accepted”
Just found this in the link you just sent :
*Please note:* the workflow will not trigger unless there is an existing record with a corresponding unique property value in your HubSpot account.
Yes, that’s why I said Bad News... :disappointed:

I have an event based workflow which triggers with a web-hook and the web-hook sends the payload containing the phone number for the phone number property of HubSpot's Contact object. All other properties are working except the phone number property.
This how the payload looks
```{
    "contact_record_id": 33329044180,
    "first_name": "FIRSTNAME",
    "last_name": "LASTNAME",
    "email": "<mailto:test@test.com|test@test.com>",
    "phone": "+46700001001",
    "unit" : "3434"
}```
How do we set the contact's phone property using HubSpot's `"Set Property Value"` action in workflows?

Hi <@U02HCG20TQ8>,

I hope you are well. This might seem like a silly one but I can see your variables match up from the webhook to the text properties, email, first_name, last_name etc. but you're calling "phone" as "tel_nr"?

Can you please confirm if you changed "phone" to "tel_nr" to match and if not, try changing this to see if it works for you? :slightly_smiling_face:
Hi, thanks for your reply. I appreciate it. It's not about matching of the names .etc It's about compatibility with the data types. :slightly_smiling_face:
Do you have Op Hub Pro ? If so, maybe you could use a block “Format data” to convert your `tel_nr`into your `Mobile phone number` ?
